Mandi Stirone  Monday December  

Three bands took the stage at Saint Marys Student Center Lounge Saturday night to battle for studio time and raise money PERIOD

The Battle of the Bands organized by the Saint Marys Dance Marathon Committee was held to raise funds for Rileys Hospital for Children and for the upcoming Dance Marathon in the spring PERIOD

Dance Marathon committee leaders said they were proud of the events success PERIOD The committees copresident Pauline Kistka said if they broke even financially the event had raised some awareness in the Saint Marys and Notre Dame communities PERIOD

Katius a poppunk band from Dayton Ohio won the contest and the prize  a recording session with Peak Audio Productions PERIOD

The three bands played to a crowd of about  students mostly from Saint Marys PERIOD

Katius members were mostly high school students with one St PERIOD Clair Community College sophomore PERIOD Katius connection to Saint Marys was through one of their members who has two sisters at the College PERIOD Katius impressed the judges with their performance of their original song Another Day and their covers of other bands PERIOD

Harpers Valley a band made of Notre Dame students Will Weicher Chris Terschluse Chris Urban Jim Weicher Rob Mineo and Chris Doolin played several songs including Hard to Hide as well as a cover of a Dave Matthews Band song PERIOD

Saxophones violins bass and drums made up its set PERIOD

They can play their instruments freshman Laura Mullen said PERIOD I like it a lot. sophomore Katie Fenner thought that they were good as well PERIOD She said she liked their incorporation of saxophone and violin PERIOD

You dont see that a lot in college bands Fenner said PERIOD Theyre original. saint Marys freshman Rebecca Schiappa performed several acoustic originals like Sweet and Sour Pork and Goodbye a song she wrote for her sister when she left for college PERIOD

Katius members were impressed by Harpers Valleys performance and said they were surprised to win first place PERIOD

Originally four bands were expected but a member of Solus and Sola jammed his finger and the band backed out about an hour before show time PERIOD
